label: TIE Get File Reputation Example
info:
This sample invokes the TIE DXL service to retrieve the reputation of a file (as
identified by hashes). The response to the TIE request is printed to the
Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

* The samples configuration step has been completed (see
  [Client Configuration](https://opendxl.github.io/node-red-contrib-dxl/jsdoc/tutorial-configuration.html)).
* A TIE service is available on the DXL fabric.

### Setup

* To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner of the
  screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a green dot
  with the word `connected` should appear under the `Get reputation from TIE`
  node.

### Running

To exercise the flow for the "notepad.exe" file, double-click the button on the
left side of the `Start Notepad.exe lookup flow` node.

To exercise the flow for the "EICAR Standard Anti-Virus Test File" file,
double-click the button on the left side of the `Start EICAR lookup flow` node.

### Output

The output in the Node-RED `debug` tab after the flow is run for the
`notepad.exe` file should appear similar to the following:

```
▶ { 1: object, 3: object }
```

Click on the right arrow buttons to expand the contents of the object. The
content should look similar to the following:

```
▼ object
 ▼ 1: object
  ▼ attributes: object
      2120340: "2139160704"
    createDate: 1451502875
    providerId: 1
    trustLevel: 99
 ▼ 3: object
  ▼ attributes: object
      2101652: "17"
      2102165: "1451502875"
      2111893: "21"
      2114965: "0"
      2139285: "72339069014638857"
    createDate: 1526675921
    providerId: 3
    trustLevel: 99
```

The `key` for each entry in the object corresponds to a particular `provider` of
the associated `reputation`. The list of file reputation providers can
be found in the
[FileProvider documentation](https://opendxl.github.io/opendxl-tie-client-javascript/jsdoc/module-FileProvider.html)
in the TIE JavaScript client SDK.

The McAfee Global Threat Intelligence (GTI) service is identified in the results
as `providerId: 1`. The trust level associated with the GTI response
(`trustLevel: 99`) indicates that the file is known good.

The output in the Node-RED `debug` tab after the flow is run for the `EICAR`
file should also appear similar to the following:

```
▶ { 1: object, 3: object }
```

Click on the right arrow buttons to expand the contents of the object. The
content should look similar to the following:

```
▼ object
 ▼ 1: object
  ▼ attributes: object
      2120340: "2139162632"
    createDate: 1451504331
    providerId: 1
    trustLevel: 1
 ▼ 3: object
  ▼ attributes: object
      2101652: "11"
      2102165: "1451504331"
      2111893: "22"
      2114965: "0"
      2139285: "72339069014638857"
    createDate: 1451504331
    providerId: 3
    trustLevel: 0
```

The trust level associated with the GTI response (`trustLevel: 1`) indicates
that the file is known bad.

See the 
[TrustLevel documentation](https://opendxl.github.io/opendxl-tie-client-javascript/jsdoc/module-TrustLevel.html)
in the TIE JavaScript client SDK for the list of standard trust levels.

### Details

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Start lookup flow

These are `inject` input nodes which start the flow.

#### Set hashes request parameter

These are `change` nodes which set values for different hash types —
`md5`, `sha1`, and `sha256` — onto an object which is stored to the
`hashes` property on the message. The `Get reputation from TIE` node uses
the `hashes` property when constructing the parameters for the TIE reputation
request. 

#### Get reputation from TIE

This is a `tie get file reputation` node. This node connects to
the DXL fabric and sends a DXL `Request` message to the TIE service to lookup
file reputation information.

The request message includes the `hashes` properties set by the
`Set hashes request parameter` nodes.

The `Return` property is set to "a parsed JSON object" to indicate that the
payload for the response should be added to the output message as a JavaScript
object decoded from JSON.

#### Output reputation

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` set on
the message by the `Get reputation from TIE` node. The output should
include information for reputation data for the file.

name: Set hashes request parameter for Notepad.exe
Set hashes request parameter for EICAR
